Ingredients: 

For the Chicken Marinade: 
• 1.5 pounds boneless, skinless chicken breasts or thighs, cut into bite-sized pieces 
• 2 tablespoons soy sauce 
• 1 tablespoon Chinese cooking wine (Shaoxing wine) or dry sherry 
• 1 tablespoon cornstarch 

For the Szechuan Sauce: 

• 3 tablespoons soy sauce 
• 2 tablespoons Chinkiang black vinegar or rice vinegar 
• 2 tablespoons sugar 
• 1 tablespoon hoisin sauce 
• 1 tablespoon oyster sauce 
• 1 teaspoon sesame oil 
• 1/2 teaspoon Szechuan peppercorns (optional for a numbing heat) 
• 2-3 tablespoons vegetable oil for stir-frying 

For the Stir-fry: 

• 1 red bell pepper, sliced 
• 1 green bell pepper, sliced 
• 1 medium carrot, julienned 
• 2-3 cloves garlic, minced 
• 1-inch piece of ginger, minced 
• 2-3 dried red chilies (adjust to your spice preference) 
• 1/2 cup unsalted peanuts (optional) 
• Fresh cilantro leaves for garnish (optional) 

Procedure: 

Marinate the Chicken: 

1. In a bowl, combine the chicken pieces with 2 tablespoons of soy sauce, 1 tablespoon of Chinese cooking wine (or sherry), and 1 tablespoon of cornstarch. Mix well and let it marinate for at least 15-20 minutes. Prepare the Szechuan Sauce: 

2. In another bowl, combine 3 tablespoons of soy sauce, 2 tablespoons of black vinegar (or rice vinegar), 2 tablespoons of sugar, 1 tablespoon of hoisin sauce, 1 tablespoon of oyster sauce, 1 teaspoon of sesame oil, and Szechuan peppercorns (if using). Mix until well combined. Taste and adjust the flavors according to your preference. Stir-fry the Chicken: 

3. Heat 2-3 tablespoons of vegetable oil in a wok or large skillet over high heat. 

4. Add the marinated chicken pieces and stir-fry until they are cooked through and slightly browned, about 4-5 minutes. Remove the chicken from the wok and set it aside. Stir-fry the Vegetables: 

5. In the same wok, add more oil if needed. Add the dried red chilies, minced garlic, and ginger. Stir-fry for about 30 seconds until fragrant. 

6. Add the sliced red and green bell peppers and julienned carrots. Stir-fry for another 2-3 minutes until the vegetables are slightly tender. Combine and Finish: 

7. Return the cooked chicken to the wok and mix it with the stir-fried vegetables. 

8. Pour the prepared Szechuan sauce over the chicken and vegetables. Stir-fry for another 2-3 minutes, ensuring everything is well coated with the sauce. 

9. If using, add the unsalted peanuts and stir until they are heated through. 

10. Serve the Szechuan Chicken hot, garnished with fresh cilantro leaves, if desired. 


Enjoy your homemade Szechuan Chicken with rice or noodles for 5 members! Adjust the amount of dried red chilies to control the spiciness to your liking.
